rdf:Description.dc:title: Bulalakaw ñg Pag-Asa
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Ismael A. Amado
Honorato de Lara
Gorgonia de Leon
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This eBook is for the use of anyone anywhere at no cost and with almost no restrictions whatsoever. You may copy it, give it away or re-use it under the terms of the Project Gutenberg License included with this eBook or online at www.gutenberg.org. This eBook is produced by Jeroen Hellingman and the Online Distributed Proofreading Team at www.pgdp.net. Bulalakaw ñg Pag-asa (falling star of hope) is a social-realist Tagalog novel set during the American colonial period. The town of Libis is ruled by the corrupt presidente municipal Kápitang Memò. Gerardo, an idealistic and patriotic young man who has always been at odds with Kápitang Memò, has exposed the latter’s shady past.
